   20: -module(beam_ssa_no_ssa_opt_SUITE).
   21: -feature(maybe_expr, enable).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0,suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25:          calls/1,tuple_matching/1,recv/1,maps/1,
   26:          cover_ssa_dead/1,combine_sw/1,share_opt/1,
   27:          beam_ssa_dead_crash/1,stack_init/1,
   28:          mapfoldl/0,mapfoldl/1,
   29:          grab_bag/1,redundant_br/1,
   30:          coverage/1,normalize/1,
   31:          trycatch/1,gh_6599/1]).
   32: 
   33: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   34: 
   35: all() ->
   36:     [mapfoldl,
   37:      {group,p}].
   38: 
   39: groups() ->
   40:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   41:       [tuple_matching,
   42:        calls,
   43:        recv,
   44:        maps,
   45:        cover_ssa_dead,
   46:        combine_sw,
   47:        share_opt,
   48:        beam_ssa_dead_crash,
   49:        stack_init,
   50:        grab_bag,
   51:        redundant_br,
   52:        coverage,
   53:        normalize,
   54:        trycatch,
   55:        gh_6599
   56:       ]}].
   57: 
   58: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   59:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: calls(Config) ->
   72:     Ret = {return,value,Config},
   73:     Ret = fun_call(fun(42) -> ok end, Ret),
   74:     Ret = apply_fun(fun(a, b) -> ok end, [a,b], Ret),
   75:     Ret = apply_mfa(test_lib, id, [anything], Ret),
   76:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch call_error()),
   77:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch call_error(42)),
   78:     5 = start_it([erlang,length,1,2,3,4,5]),
   79: 
   80:     {_,ok} = cover_call(id(true)),
   81:     {_,ok} = cover_call(id(false)),
   82:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,ok},_}} = catch cover_call(id(ok)),
   83: 
   84:     ok.
   85: 
   86: fun_call(Fun, X0) ->
   87:     X = id(X0),
   88:     Fun(42),
   89:     X.
   90: 
   91: apply_fun(Fun, Args, X0) ->
   92:     X = id(X0),
   93:     apply(Fun, Args),
   94:     X.
   95: 
   96: apply_mfa(Mod, Name, Args, X0) ->
   97:     X = id(X0),
   98:     apply(Mod, Name, Args),
   99:     X.
  100: 
  101: call_error() ->
  102:     error(badarg),
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: call_error(I) ->
  106:     <<I:(-8)>>,
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: start_it([_|_]=MFA) ->
  110:     case MFA of
  111: 	[M,F|Args] -> M:F(Args)
  112:     end.
  113: 
  114: cover_call(A) ->
  115:     case A =/= ok of
  116:         B ->
  117:             {(term_to_binary(ok)),
  118:              case ok of
  119:                  _  when B -> ok
  120:              end}
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: 
  124: tuple_matching(_Config) ->
  125:     do_tuple_matching({tag,42}),
  126: 
  127:     true = is_two_tuple({a,b}),
  128:     false = is_two_tuple({a,b,c}),
  129:     false = is_two_tuple(atom),
  130: 
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: do_tuple_matching(Arg) ->
  134:     Res = do_tuple_matching_1(Arg),
  135:     Res = do_tuple_matching_2(Arg),
  136:     Res = do_tuple_matching_3(Arg),
  137:     Res.
  138: 
  139: do_tuple_matching_1({tag,V}) ->
  140:     {ok,V}.
  141: 
  142: do_tuple_matching_2(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  143:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  144:     if
  145:         Size =:= 2 ->
  146:             {ok,element(2, Tuple)}
  147:     end.
  148: 
  149: do_tuple_matching_3(Tuple) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  150:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  151:     if
  152:         Size =:= 2 ->
  153:             2 = id(Size),
  154:             {ok,element(2, Tuple)}
  155:     end.
  156: 
  157: is_two_tuple(Arg) ->
  158:     case is_tuple(Arg) of
  159:         false -> false;
  160:         true -> tuple_size(Arg) == 2
  161:     end.
  162: 
  163: -record(reporter_state, {res,run_config}).
  164: -record(run_config, {report_interval=0}).
  165: 
  166: recv(_Config) ->
  167:     Parent = self(),
  168: 
  169:     %% Test sync_wait_mon/2.
  170:     Succ = fun() -> Parent ! {ack,self(),{result,42}} end,
  171:     {result,42} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Succ), infinity),
  172: 
  173:     Down = fun() -> exit(down) end,
  174:     {error,down} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Down), infinity),
  175: 
  176:     Exit = fun() ->
  177:                    Self = self(),
  178:                    spawn(fun() -> exit(Self, kill_me) end),
  179:                    receive _ -> ok end
  180:            end,
  181:     {error,kill_me} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Exit), infinity),
  182: 
  183:     Timeout = fun() -> receive _ -> ok end end,
  184:     {error,timeout} = sync_wait_mon(spawn_monitor(Timeout), 0),
  185: 
  186:     %% Test reporter_loop/1.
  187:     {a,Parent} = reporter_loop(#reporter_state{res={a,Parent},
  188:                                                run_config=#run_config{}}),
  189: 
  190:     %% Test bad_sink/0.
  191:     bad_sink(),
  192: 
  193:     %% Test tricky_recv_1/0.
  194:     self() ! 1,
  195:     a = tricky_recv_1(),
  196:     self() ! 2,
  197:     b = tricky_recv_1(),
  198: 
  199:     %% Test tricky_recv_2/0.
  200:     self() ! 1,
  201:     {1,yes} = tricky_recv_2(),
  202:     self() ! 2,
  203:     {2,'maybe'} = tricky_recv_2(),
  204: 
  205:     %% Test 'receive after infinity' in try/catch.
  206:     Pid = spawn(fun recv_after_inf_in_try/0),
  207:     exit(Pid, done),
  208: 
  209:     %% Test tricky_recv_3().
  210:     self() ! {{self(),r0},{1,42,"name"}},
  211:     {Parent,r0,[<<1:32,1:8,42:8>>,"name",0]} = tricky_recv_3(),
  212:     self() ! {{self(),r1},{2,99,<<"data">>}},
  213:     {Parent,r1,<<1:32,2:8,99:8,"data">>} = tricky_recv_3(),
  214: 
  215:     %% Test tricky_recv_4().
  216:     self() ! {[self(),r0],{1,42,"name"}},
  217:     {Parent,r0,[<<1:32,1:8,42:8>>,"name",0]} = tricky_recv_4(),
  218:     self() ! {[self(),r1],{2,99,<<"data">>}},
  219:     {Parent,r1,<<1:32,2:8,99:8,"data">>} = tricky_recv_4(),
  220: 
  221:     %% Test tricky_recv_5/0.
  222:     self() ! 1,
  223:     a = tricky_recv_5(),
  224:     self() ! 2,
  225:     b = tricky_recv_5(),
  226: 
  227:     %% Test tricky_recv_5a/0.
  228:     self() ! 1,
  229:     a = tricky_recv_5a(),
  230:     self() ! 2,
  231:     b = tricky_recv_5a(),
  232:     self() ! any,
  233:     b = tricky_recv_5a(),
  234: 
  235:     %% tricky_recv_6/0 is a compile-time error.
  236:     tricky_recv_6(),
  237: 
  238:     recv_coverage(),
  239: 
  240:     ok.
  241: 
  242: sync_wait_mon({Pid, Ref}, Timeout) ->
  243:     receive
  244: 	{ack,Pid,Return} ->
  245: 	    erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  246: 	    Return;
  247: 	{'DOWN',Ref,_Type,Pid,Reason} ->
  248: 	    {error,Reason};
  249: 	{'EXIT',Pid,Reason} ->
  250: 	    erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  251: 	    {error,Reason}
  252:     after Timeout ->
  253:             erlang:demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  254:             exit(Pid, kill),
  255:             {error,timeout}
  256:     end.
  257: 
  258: reporter_loop(State) ->
  259:     RC = State#reporter_state.run_config,
  260:     receive after RC#run_config.report_interval ->
  261:                     State#reporter_state.res
  262:     end.
  263: 
  264: bad_sink() ->
  265:     {ok,Pid} = my_spawn(self()),
  266:     %% The get_tuple_element instruction for the matching
  267:     %% above was sinked into the receive loop. That will
  268:     %% not work (and would be bad for performance if it
  269:     %% would work).
  270:     receive
  271:         {ok,Pid} ->
  272:             ok;
  273:         error ->
  274:             exit(failed)
  275:     end,
  276:     exit(Pid, kill).
  277: 
  278: my_spawn(Parent) ->
  279:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  280:                         Parent ! {ok,self()},
  281:                         receive _ -> ok end
  282:                 end),
  283:     {ok,Pid}.
  284: 
  285: tricky_recv_1() ->
  286:     receive
  287:         X=1 ->
  288:             id(42),
  289:             a;
  290:         X=2 ->
  291:             b
  292:     end,
  293:     case X of
  294:         1 -> a;
  295:         2 -> b
  296:     end.
  297: 
  298: tricky_recv_2() ->
  299:     receive
  300:         X=1 ->
  301:             Y = case id(X) of
  302:                     1 -> yes;
  303:                     _ -> no
  304:                 end,
  305:             a;
  306:         X=2 ->
  307:             Y = 'maybe',
  308:             b
  309:     end,
  310:     {X,Y}.
  311: 
  312: recv_after_inf_in_try() ->
  313:     try
  314:         %% Used to crash beam_kernel_to_ssa.
  315:         receive after infinity -> ok end
  316:     catch
  317: 	_A:_B ->
  318: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  319:     end.
  320: 
  321: tricky_recv_3() ->
  322:     {Pid, R, Request} =
  323: 	receive
  324: 	    {{Pid0,R0}, {1, Proto0, Name0}} ->
  325: 		{Pid0, R0,
  326: 		 [<<1:32, 1:8, Proto0:8>>,Name0,0]};
  327: 	    {{Pid1,R1}, {2, Proto1, Data1}}  ->
  328: 		{Pid1, R1,
  329: 		 <<1:32, 2:8, Proto1:8, Data1/binary>>}
  330: 	end,
  331:     id({Pid,R,Request}).
  332: 
  333: tricky_recv_4() ->
  334:     {Pid, R, Request} =
  335: 	receive
  336: 	    {[Pid0,R0], {1, Proto0, Name0}} ->
  337: 		{Pid0, R0,
  338: 		 [<<1:32, 1:8, Proto0:8>>,Name0,0]};
  339: 	    {[Pid1,R1], {2, Proto1, Data1}}  ->
  340: 		{Pid1, R1,
  341: 		 <<1:32, 2:8, Proto1:8, Data1/binary>>}
  342: 	end,
  343:     id({Pid,R,Request}).
  344: 
  345: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would accidentally create phi nodes on critical edges
  346: %% when fixing up receives; the call to id/2 can either succeed or land in the
  347: %% catch block, and we added a phi node to its immediate successor.
  348: tricky_recv_5() ->
  349:     try
  350:         receive
  351:             X=1 ->
  352:                 id(42),
  353:                 a;
  354:             X=2 ->
  355:                 b
  356:         end,
  357:         case X of
  358:             1 -> a;
  359:             2 -> b
  360:         end
  361:     catch
  362:         _:_ -> c
  363:     end.
  364: 
  365: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would find the wrong exit block when fixing up
  366: %% receives.
  367: tricky_recv_5a() ->
  368:     try
  369:         receive
  370:             X=1 ->
  371:                 id(42),
  372:                 a;
  373:             X=_ ->
  374:                 b
  375:         end,
  376:         %% The following is the code in the common exit block.
  377:         if X =:= 1 -> a;
  378:            true -> b
  379:         end
  380:     catch
  381:         %% But this code with the landingpad instruction was found,
  382:         %% because it happened to occur before the true exit block
  383:         %% in the reverse post order.
  384:         _:_ -> c
  385:     end.
  386: 
  387: 
  388: %% When fixing tricky_recv_5, we introduced a compiler crash when the common
  389: %% exit block was ?EXCEPTION_BLOCK and floats were in the picture.
  390: tricky_recv_6() ->
  391:     RefA = make_ref(),
  392:     RefB = make_ref(),
  393:     receive
  394:         {RefA, Number} -> Number + 1.0;
  395:         {RefB, Number} -> Number + 2.0
  396:     after 0 ->
  397:         ok
  398:     end.
  399: 
  400: recv_coverage() ->
  401:     self() ! 1,
  402:     a = recv_coverage_1(),
  403:     self() ! 2,
  404:     b = recv_coverage_1(),
  405: 
  406:     self() ! 1,
  407:     a = recv_coverage_2(),
  408:     self() ! 2,
  409:     b = recv_coverage_2(),
  410: 
  411:     ok.
  412: 
  413: %% Similar to tricky_recv_5/0, but provides test coverage for the #b_switch{}
  414: %% terminator.
  415: recv_coverage_1() ->
  416:     receive
  417:         X=1 ->
  418:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_switch{list=L}
  419:             case id(0) of
  420:                 0 -> a;
  421:                 1 -> b;
  422:                 2 -> c;
  423:                 3 -> d
  424:             end;
  425:         X=2 ->
  426:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_switch{fail=F}
  427:             case id(42) of
  428:                 0 -> exit(quit);
  429:                 1 -> exit(quit);
  430:                 2 -> exit(quit);
  431:                 3 -> exit(quit);
  432:                 _ -> b
  433:             end
  434:     end,
  435:     case X of
  436:         1 -> a;
  437:         2 -> b
  438:     end.
  439: 
  440: %% Similar to recv_coverage_1/0, providing test coverage for #b_br{}.
  441: recv_coverage_2() ->
  442:     receive
  443:         X=1 ->
  444:             A = id(1),
  445:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_br{succ=S}.
  446:             if
  447:                 A =:= 1 -> a;
  448:                 true -> exit(quit)
  449:             end;
  450:         X=2 ->
  451:             A = id(2),
  452:             %% Jump to common exit block through #b_br{fail=F}.
  453:             if
  454:                 A =:= 1 -> exit(quit);
  455:                 true -> a
  456:             end
  457:     end,
  458:     case X of
  459:         1 -> a;
  460:         2 -> b
  461:     end.
  462: 
  463: maps(_Config) ->
  464:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,#{}},_}} = (catch maps_1(any)),
  465: 
  466:     {jkl,nil,nil} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, jkl => 0}),
  467:     {def,ghi,abc} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, def => 0}),
  468:     {def,ghi,jkl} = maps_2(#{def => 0, jkl => 0}),
  469:     {mno,nil,abc} = maps_2(#{abc => 0, mno => 0, jkl => 0}),
  470:     {jkl,nil,nil} = maps_2(#{jkl => 0}),
  471:     error = maps_2(#{}),
  472: 
  473:     [] = maps_3(),
  474: 
  475:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,true},_}} = catch maps_4(id(true), id(true)),
  476:     error = maps_4(id(#{}), id(true)),
  477:     error = maps_4(id(#{}), id(#{})),
  478: 
  479:     ok.
  480: 
  481: maps_1(K) ->
  482:     _ = id(42),
  483:     #{K:=V} = #{},
  484:     V.
  485: 
  486: maps_2(Map) ->
  487:     Res = maps_2a(Map),
  488:     Res = maps_2b(Map),
  489:     Res.
  490: 
  491: maps_2a(#{} = Map) ->
  492:     case case Abc = is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  493:              false -> false;
  494:              _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  495:          end of
  496:         true ->
  497:             {def, ghi, abc};
  498:         false ->
  499:             case case Jkl = is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  500:                      false -> false;
  501:                      _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  502:                  end of
  503:                 true ->
  504:                     {def, ghi, jkl};
  505:                 false ->
  506:                     case case Abc of
  507:                              false -> false;
  508:                              _ -> is_map_key(mno, Map)
  509:                          end of
  510:                         true ->
  511:                             {mno, nil, abc};
  512:                         false ->
  513:                             case Jkl of
  514:                                 true -> {jkl, nil, nil};
  515:                                 false -> error
  516:                             end
  517:                     end
  518:             end
  519:     end.
  520: 
  521: maps_2b(#{}=Map) ->
  522:     case case is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  523:              false -> false;
  524:              _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  525:          end of
  526:         true ->
  527:             {def, ghi, abc};
  528:         false ->
  529:             case case is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  530:                      false -> false;
  531:                      _ -> is_map_key(def, Map)
  532:                  end of
  533:                 true ->
  534:                     {def, ghi, jkl};
  535:                 false ->
  536:                     case case is_map_key(abc, Map) of
  537:                              false -> false;
  538:                              _ -> is_map_key(mno, Map)
  539:                          end of
  540:                         true ->
  541:                             {mno, nil, abc};
  542:                         false ->
  543:                             case is_map_key(jkl, Map) of
  544:                                 true -> {jkl, nil, nil};
  545:                                 false -> error
  546:                             end
  547:                     end
  548:             end
  549:     end.
  550: 
  551: %% Cover code in beam_ssa_codegen.
  552: maps_3() ->
  553:     [] = case #{} of
  554:              #{ok := {}} ->
  555:                  ok;
  556:              _ ->
  557:                  []
  558:          end -- [].
  559: 
  560: maps_4(A, B = A) when B; A ->
  561:     A#{ok := ok},
  562:     try A of
  563:         B -> B
  564:     after
  565:         ok
  566:     end#{ok := ok};
  567: maps_4(_, _) ->
  568:     error.
  569: 
  570: -record(wx_ref, {type=any_type,ref=any_ref}).
  571: 
  572: cover_ssa_dead(_Config) ->
  573:     str = format_str(str, escapable, [], true),
  574:     [iolist,str] = format_str(str, escapable, iolist, true),
  575:     bad = format_str(str, not_escapable, [], true),
  576:     bad = format_str(str, not_escapable, iolist, true),
  577:     bad = format_str(str, escapable, [], false),
  578:     bad = format_str(str, escapable, [], bad),
  579: 
  580:     DefWxRef = #wx_ref{},
  581:     {DefWxRef,77,9999,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77, 9999),
  582:     {DefWxRef,77.0,9999,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77.0, 9999),
  583:     {DefWxRef,77,9999.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77, 9999.0),
  584:     {DefWxRef,77.0,9999.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, 77.0, 9999.0),
  585:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43,[option]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43}, [option]),
  586:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43}, []),
  587:     {any_type,any_ref,42.0,43,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42.0,43}, []),
  588:     {any_type,any_ref,42,43.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42,43.0}, []),
  589:     {any_type,any_ref,42.0,43.0,[]} = contains(#wx_ref{}, {42.0,43.0}, []),
  590: 
  591:     nope = conv_alub(false, '=:='),
  592:     ok = conv_alub(true, '=:='),
  593:     ok = conv_alub(true, none),
  594:     error = conv_alub(false, none),
  595: 
  596:     {false,false} = eval_alu(false, false, false),
  597:     {true,false}  = eval_alu(false, false, true),
  598:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(false, true, false),
  599:     {false,false} = eval_alu(false, true, true),
  600:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(true, false, false),
  601:     {false,false} = eval_alu(true, false, true),
  602:     {true,true}   = eval_alu(true, true, false),
  603:     {false,true}  = eval_alu(true, true, true),
  604: 
  605:     100.0 = percentage(1.0, 0.0),
  606:     100.0 = percentage(1, 0),
  607:     0.0 = percentage(0, 0),
  608:     0.0 = percentage(0.0, 0.0),
  609:     40.0 = percentage(4.0, 10.0),
  610:     60.0 = percentage(6, 10),
  611: 
  612:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,42},_}} = (catch #{key => abs(("a" = id(42)) /= teacher)}),
  613: 
  614:     <<>> = id(<< V || V <- [], V andalso false >>),
  615: 
  616:     false = id(([] = id([])) =/= []),
  617: 
  618:     ok.
  619: 
  620: format_str(Str, FormatData, IoList, EscChars) ->
  621:     Escapable = FormatData =:= escapable,
  622:     case id(Str) of
  623:         IoStr when Escapable, EscChars, IoList == [] ->
  624:             id(IoStr);
  625:         IoStr when Escapable, EscChars ->
  626:             [IoList,id(IoStr)];
  627:         _ ->
  628:             bad
  629:     end.
  630: 
  631: contains(This, X, Y) when is_record(This, wx_ref), is_number(X), is_number(Y) ->
  632:     {This,X,Y,[]};
  633: contains(#wx_ref{type=ThisT,ref=ThisRef}, {CX,CY}, Options)
  634:   when is_number(CX), is_number(CY), is_list(Options) ->
  635:     {ThisT,ThisRef,CX,CY,Options}.
  636: 
  637: conv_alub(HasDst, CmpOp) ->
  638:     case (not HasDst) andalso CmpOp =/= none of
  639:         true -> nope;
  640:         false ->
  641:             case HasDst of
  642:                 false -> error;
  643:                 true -> ok
  644:             end
  645:     end.
  646: 
  647: eval_alu(Sign1, Sign2, N) ->
  648:     V = (Sign1 andalso Sign2 andalso (not N))
  649:         or ((not Sign1) andalso (not Sign2) andalso N),
  650:     C = (Sign1 andalso Sign2)
  651:           or ((not N) andalso (Sign1 orelse Sign2)),
  652:     {V,C}.
  653: 
  654: percentage(Divident, Divisor) ->
  655:     if Divisor == 0 andalso Divident /= 0 ->
  656:             100.0;
  657:        Divisor == 0 ->
  658:             0.0;
  659:        true ->
  660:             Divident / Divisor * 100
  661:     end.
  662: 
  663: combine_sw(_Config) ->
  664:     [a] = do_comb_sw_1(a),
  665:     [b,b] = do_comb_sw_1(b),
  666:     [c] = do_comb_sw_1(c),
  667:     [c] = do_comb_sw_1(c),
  668:     [] = do_comb_sw_1(z),
  669: 
  670:     [a] = do_comb_sw_2(a),
  671:     [b2,b1] = do_comb_sw_2(b),
  672:     [c] = do_comb_sw_2(c),
  673:     [c] = do_comb_sw_2(c),
  674:     [] = do_comb_sw_2(z),
  675: 
  676:     ok.
  677: 
  678: do_comb_sw_1(X) ->
  679:     put(?MODULE, []),
  680:     if
  681:         X == a; X == b ->
  682:             put(?MODULE, [X|get(?MODULE)]);
  683:         true ->
  684:             ok
  685:     end,
  686:     if
  687:         X == b; X == c ->
  688:             put(?MODULE, [X|get(?MODULE)]);
  689:         true ->
  690:             ok
  691:     end,
  692:     erase(?MODULE).
  693: 
  694: do_comb_sw_2(X) ->
  695:     put(?MODULE, []),
  696:     case X of
  697:         a ->
  698:             put(?MODULE, [a|get(?MODULE)]);
  699:         b ->
  700:             put(?MODULE, [b1|get(?MODULE)]);
  701:         _ ->
  702:             ok
  703:     end,
  704:     case X of
  705:         b ->
  706:             put(?MODULE, [b2|get(?MODULE)]);
  707:         c ->
  708:             put(?MODULE, [c|get(?MODULE)]);
  709:         _ ->
  710:             ok
  711:     end,
  712:     erase(?MODULE).
  713: 
  714: share_opt(_Config) ->
  715:     ok = do_share_opt_1(0),
  716:     ok = do_share_opt_2(),
  717:     ok = do_share_opt_3(),
  718:     ok.
  719: 
  720: do_share_opt_1(A) ->
  721:     %% The compiler would be stuck in an infinite loop in beam_ssa_share.
  722:     case A of
  723:         0 -> a;
  724:         1 -> b;
  725:         2 -> c
  726:     end,
  727:     receive after 1 -> ok end.
  728: 
  729: do_share_opt_2() ->
  730:     ok = sopt_2({[pointtopoint], [{dstaddr,any}]}, ok),
  731:     ok = sopt_2({[broadcast], [{broadaddr,any}]}, ok),
  732:     ok = sopt_2({[], []}, ok),
  733:     ok.
  734: 
  735: sopt_2({Flags, Opts}, ok) ->
  736:     Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
  737:     P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
  738:     case Opts of
  739:         %% The following two clauses would be combined to one, silently
  740:         %% discarding the guard test of the P2P variable.
  741:         [{broadaddr,_}|Os] when Broadcast ->
  742:             sopt_2({Flags, Os}, ok);
  743:         [{dstaddr,_}|Os] when P2P ->
  744:             sopt_2({Flags, Os}, ok);
  745:         [] ->
  746:             ok
  747:     end.
  748: 
  749: do_share_opt_3() ->
  750:     true = sopt_3(id(ok)),
  751:     false = sopt_3(id(nok)),
  752:     ok.
  753: 
  754: sopt_3(X) ->
  755:     %% Must be one line to trigger bug.
  756:     case X of ok -> id(?LINE), true; _ -> id(?LINE), false end.
  757: 
  758: beam_ssa_dead_crash(_Config) ->
  759:     not_A_B = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(id(false), id(true)),
  760:     not_A_not_B = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(false, false),
  761:     neither = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(true, false),
  762:     neither = do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(true, true),
  763:     ok.
  764: 
  765: do_beam_ssa_dead_crash(A, B) ->
  766:     %% beam_ssa_dead attempts to shortcut branches that branch other
  767:     %% branches. When a two-way branch is encountered, beam_ssa_dead
  768:     %% will simulate execution along both paths, in the hope that both
  769:     %% paths happens to end up in the same place.
  770:     %%
  771:     %% During the simulated execution of this function, the boolean
  772:     %% variable for a `br` instruction would be replaced with the
  773:     %% literal atom `nil`, which is not allowed, and would crash the
  774:     %% compiler. In practice, during the actual execution, control
  775:     %% would never be transferred to that `br` instruction when the
  776:     %% variable in question had the value `nil`.
  777:     %%
  778:     %% beam_ssa_dead has been updated to immediately abort the search
  779:     %% along the current path if there is an attempt to substitute a
  780:     %% non-boolean value into a `br` instruction.
  781: 
  782:     case
  783:         case not A of
  784:             false ->
  785:                 false;
  786:             true ->
  787:                 B
  788:         end
  789:     of
  790:         V
  791:             when
  792:                 V /= nil
  793:                 andalso
  794:                 V /= false ->
  795:             not_A_B;
  796:         _ ->
  797:             case
  798:                 case not A of
  799:                     false ->
  800:                         false;
  801:                     true ->
  802:                         not B
  803:                 end
  804:             of
  805:                 true ->
  806:                     not_A_not_B;
  807:                 false ->
  808:                     neither
  809:             end
  810:     end.
  811: 
  812: stack_init(_Config) ->
  813:     6 = stack_init(a, #{a => [1,2,3]}),
  814:     0 = stack_init(missing, #{}),
  815:     ok.
  816: 
  817: stack_init(Key, Map) ->
  818:     %% beam_ssa_codegen would wrongly assume that y(0) would always be
  819:     %% initialized by the `get_map_elements` instruction that follows, and
  820:     %% would set up the stack frame using an `allocate` instruction and
  821:     %% would not generate an `init` instruction to initialize y(0).
  822:     Res = case Map of
  823:               #{Key := Elements} ->
  824:                   %% Elements will be assigned to y(0) if the key Key exists.
  825:                   lists:foldl(fun(El, Acc) ->
  826:                                       Acc + El
  827:                               end, 0, Elements);
  828:               #{} ->
  829:                   %% y(0) will be left uninitialized when the key is not
  830:                   %% present in the map.
  831:                   0
  832:           end,
  833:     %% y(0) would be uninitialized here if the key was not present in the map
  834:     %% (if the second clause was executed).
  835:     id(Res).
  836: 
  837: %% Test that compiler "optimizations" don't rewrite mapfold/3 to the
  838: %% equivalent of slow_mapfoldl/3.
  839: mapfoldl() ->
  840:     {N,Size} = mapfoldl_limits(),
  841:     {Time,_} = timer:tc(fun() ->
  842:                                 mapfoldl(fun(Sz, _) ->
  843:                                                  erlang:garbage_collect(),
  844:                                                  {Sz,erlang:make_tuple(Sz, a)}
  845:                                          end, [], [Size])
  846:                         end),
  847:     Seconds = 15 + ceil(10 * Time * N / 1_000_000),
  848:     io:format("~p seconds timetrap\n", [Seconds]),
  849:     [{timetrap,{seconds,Seconds}}].
  850: 
  851: mapfoldl(_Config) ->
  852:     test_mapfoldl_implementations(),
  853:     F = fun(Sz, _) ->
  854:                 erlang:garbage_collect(),
  855:                 {Sz,erlang:make_tuple(Sz, a)}
  856:         end,
  857:     {N,Size} = mapfoldl_limits(),
  858:     List = lists:duplicate(N, Size),
  859:     {List,Tuple} = mapfoldl(F, [], List),
  860:     {List,Tuple} = fast_mapfoldl(F, [], List),
  861:     Size = tuple_size(Tuple),
  862:     ok.
  863: 
  864: mapfoldl_limits() ->
  865:     {1_000,100_000}.
  866: 
  867: test_mapfoldl_implementations() ->
  868:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 10),
  869:     F = fun(N, Sum) -> {N,Sum+N} end,
  870:     {Seq,55} = mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  871:     {Seq,55} = fast_mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  872:     {Seq,55} = slow_mapfoldl(F, 0, Seq),
  873:     ok.
  874: 
  875: mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  876:     {R,Acc1} = F(Hd, Acc0),
  877:     {Rs,Acc2} = mapfoldl(F, Acc1, Tail),
  878:     {[R|Rs],Acc2};
  879: mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  880: 
  881: %% Here is an illustration of how the compiler used to sink
  882: %% get_tuple_element instructions in a way that would cause all
  883: %% versions of the accumulator to be kept until the end. The compiler
  884: %% now uses a heuristic to only sink get_tuple_element instructions if
  885: %% that would cause fewer values to be saved in the stack frame.
  886: slow_mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  887:     Res1 = F(Hd, Acc0),
  888:     %% By saving the Res1 tuple, all intermediate accumulators will be
  889:     %% kept to the end.
  890:     Res2 = slow_mapfoldl(F, element(2, Res1), Tail),
  891:     {[element(1, Res1)|element(1, Res2)],element(2, Res2)};
  892: slow_mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  893: 
  894: %% Here is an illustration how the compiler should compile mapfoldl/3
  895: %% to avoid keeping all intermediate accumulators. Note that
  896: %% slow_mapfoldl/3 and fast_mapfoldl/3 use the same amount of stack
  897: %% space.
  898: fast_mapfoldl(F, Acc0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
  899:     Res1 = F(Hd, Acc0),
  900:     R = element(1, Res1),
  901:     Res2 = fast_mapfoldl(F, element(2, Res1), Tail),
  902:     {[R|element(1, Res2)],element(2, Res2)};
  903: fast_mapfoldl(F, Acc, []) when is_function(F, 2) -> {[],Acc}.
  904: 
  905: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  906:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_1()),
  907:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_2()),
  908:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_3()),
  909:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_4()),
  910:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,[{?MODULE,grab_bag_5,[a,17],_}|_]}} =
  911:         (catch grab_bag_5(a, 17)),
  912:     way = grab_bag_6(face),
  913:     no_match = grab_bag_6("ABC"),
  914:     no_match = grab_bag_6(any),
  915:     ok = grab_bag_7(),
  916:     [] = grab_bag_8(),
  917:     ok = grab_bag_9(),
  918:     whatever = grab_bag_10(ignore, whatever),
  919:     other = grab_bag_11(),
  920:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch grab_bag_12()),
  921:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,[]},_}} = (catch grab_bag_13()),
  922:     timeout = grab_bag_14(),
  923:     ?MODULE = grab_bag_15(?MODULE),
  924: 
  925:     error = grab_bag_16a(timeout_value),
  926:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch grab_bag_16a(whatever)),
  927:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch grab_bag_16b(whatever)),
  928:     timeout_value = grab_bag_16b(error),
  929: 
  930:     fact = grab_bag_17(),
  931: 
  932:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,[]},[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_18(),
  933: 
  934:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,[whatever]},[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_19(),
  935: 
  936:     {'EXIT',{if_clause,[_|_]}} = catch grab_bag_20(),
  937: 
  938:     6 = grab_bag_21(id(64)),
  939:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch grab_bag_21(id(a)),
  940: 
  941:     false = grab_bag_22(),
  942: 
  943:     ok.
  944: 
  945: grab_bag_1() ->
  946:     %% beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash when attempting to translate a make_fun
  947:     %% instruction without a destination variable.
  948:     (catch fun () -> 15 end)(true#{}).
  949: 
  950: grab_bag_2() ->
  951:     %% is_guard_cg_safe/1 will be called with #cg_unreachable{}, which was
  952:     %% not handled.
  953:     27
  954:         or
  955:     try
  956:         try
  957:             x#{}
  958:         catch
  959:             _:_ ->
  960:                 []
  961:         end
  962:     after
  963:         false
  964:     end.
  965: 
  966: grab_bag_3() ->
  967:     case
  968:         fun (V0)
  969:               when
  970:                   %% The only thing left after optimizations would be
  971:                   %% a bs_add instruction not followed by succeeded,
  972:                   %% which would crash beam_ssa_codegen because there
  973:                   %% was no failure label available.
  974:                   binary_part(<<>>,
  975:                               <<V0:V0/unit:196>>) ->
  976:                 []
  977:         end
  978:     of
  979:         <<>> ->
  980:             []
  981:     end.
  982: 
  983: grab_bag_4() ->
  984:     %% beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash because there was a #cg_phi{}
  985:     %% instruction that was not referenced from any #cg_break{}.
  986:     case $f of
  987:         V0 ->
  988:             try
  989:                 try fy of
  990:                     V0 ->
  991:                         fu
  992:                 catch
  993:                     throw:$s ->
  994:                         fy
  995:                 end
  996:             catch
  997:                 error:#{#{[] + [] => []} := false} when [] ->
  998:                     fy
  999:             after
 1000:                 ok
 1001:             end
 1002:     end.
 1003: 
 1004: grab_bag_5(_A, _B) when <<business:(node(power))>> ->
 1005:     true.
 1006: 
 1007: grab_bag_6(face) ->
 1008:     way;
 1009: grab_bag_6("ABC") when (node([]))#{size(door) => $k} ->
 1010:     false;
 1011: grab_bag_6(_) ->
 1012:     no_match.
 1013: 
 1014: grab_bag_7() ->
 1015:     catch
 1016:         case
 1017:             case 1.6 of
 1018:                 %% The hd([] call will be translated to erlang:error(badarg).
 1019:                 %% This case exports two variables in Core Erlang (the
 1020:                 %% return value of the case and V). beam_kernel_to_ssa was not
 1021:                 %% prepared to handle a call to error/1 which is supposed to
 1022:                 %% export two variables.
 1023:                 <<0.5:(hd([])),V:false>> ->
 1024:                     ok
 1025:             end
 1026:         of
 1027:             _ ->
 1028:                 V
 1029:         end,
 1030:         ok.
 1031: 
 1032: %% ssa_opt_sink would crash if sys_core_fold had not been run.
 1033: grab_bag_8() ->
 1034:     try
 1035:         []
 1036:     catch
 1037:         _:_ ->
 1038:             try
 1039:                 []
 1040:             catch
 1041:                 _:any:_ ->
 1042:                     a
 1043:             end;
 1044:         _:right ->
 1045:             b
 1046:     end.
 1047: 
 1048: %% The ssa_opt_try optimization would leave a succeeded:body
 1049: %% instruction followed by a #b_ret{} terminator, which would crash
 1050: %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
 1051: grab_bag_9() ->
 1052:     catch
 1053:         <<1 || 99, [] <- hour>> bsr false,
 1054:         ok.
 1055: 
 1056: grab_bag_10(_, V) ->
 1057:     %% This function needs a stack frame in order to preserve V.
 1058:     fun() -> ok end,
 1059:     V.
 1060: 
 1061: grab_bag_11() ->
 1062:     try 0 of
 1063:         false -> error;
 1064:         true -> ok;
 1065:         _ -> other
 1066:     catch
 1067:         _:_ ->
 1068:             caught
 1069:     end.
 1070: 
 1071: grab_bag_12() ->
 1072:     %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would try to place the created map in x1.
 1073:     %% That would not be safe because x0 is not initialized.
 1074:     check_process_code(1, (#{})#{key := teacher}),
 1075:     ok.
 1076: 
 1077: grab_bag_13() ->
 1078:     %% If sys_core_fold was skipped, beam_ssa_beam would leave
 1079:     %% unreachable code with invalid phi nodes.
 1080:     case <<810:true>> = [] of
 1081:         <<709:false>> ->
 1082:             ok;
 1083:         whatever ->
 1084:             case 42 of
 1085:                 175 ->
 1086:                     {ok,case "b" of
 1087:                             $X -> time
 1088:                         end}
 1089:             end
 1090:     end.
 1091: 
 1092: grab_bag_14() ->
 1093:     %% If optimizations were turned off, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would
 1094:     %% sanitize the binary construction instruction, replacing it with
 1095:     %% a call to erlang:error/1, which is not allowed in a receive.
 1096:     receive
 1097:         #{<<42:(-1)>> := _} ->
 1098:             ok
 1099:     after 0 ->
 1100:             timeout
 1101:     end.
 1102: 
 1103: grab_bag_15(V) ->
 1104:     %% Instead of:
 1105:     %%
 1106:     %%    move x0, y0
 1107:     %%    move y0, x0
 1108:     %%
 1109:     %% a swap instruction would be emitted by beam_ssa_codegen:
 1110:     %%
 1111:     %%    swap x0, y0
 1112:     %%
 1113:     case [] of
 1114:         [] -> V
 1115:     end:all(),
 1116:     V.
 1117: 
 1118: grab_bag_16a(V) ->
 1119:     try
 1120:         catch 22,
 1121:     receive
 1122:     after bad ->
 1123:             not_reached
 1124:     end
 1125:     catch
 1126:         _:V ->
 1127:             error
 1128:     end.
 1129: 
 1130: grab_bag_16b(V) ->
 1131:     try
 1132:         receive
 1133:         after get() ->
 1134:                 ok
 1135:         end
 1136:     catch
 1137:         V:Reason ->
 1138:             Reason
 1139:     end.
 1140: 
 1141: grab_bag_17() ->
 1142:     try "xwCl" of
 1143:         V when V ->
 1144:             <<[] || V>>;
 1145:         [_|_] ->
 1146:             %% Constant propagation in beam_ssa_codegen:prefer_xregs/2
 1147:             %% would produce get_hd and get_tl instructions with literal
 1148:             %% operands.
 1149:             fact
 1150:     catch
 1151:         _:_ ->
 1152:             []
 1153:     end.
 1154: 
 1155: grab_bag_18() ->
 1156:     try 0 of
 1157:         _V0 ->
 1158:             bnot false
 1159:     after
 1160:         try [] of
 1161:             wrong ->
 1162:                 ok
 1163:         catch
 1164:             _:_ when false ->
 1165:                 error
 1166:         end
 1167:     end.
 1168: 
 1169: grab_bag_19() ->
 1170:     ([<<bad/utf8>>] =
 1171:          %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen would produce single-valued phi
 1172:          %% nodes, which in turn would cause the constant propagation
 1173:          %% in beam_ssa_codegen:prefer_xregs/2 to produce get_hd and
 1174:          %% get_tl instructions with literal operands.
 1175:          try
 1176:              [whatever]
 1177:          catch
 1178:              _:_ when false ->
 1179:                  ok
 1180:          end) ! (some_atom ++ <<>>).
 1181: 
 1182: grab_bag_20() ->
 1183:     %% Similarly to grab_bag_19, beam_ssa_pre_codegen would produce
 1184:     %% single-valued phi nodes. The fix for grab_bag_19 would not
 1185:     %% suffice because several phi nodes were involved.
 1186:     {[_ | _] =
 1187:          receive
 1188:              list ->
 1189:                  "list";
 1190:              1 when day ->
 1191:                  []
 1192:          after
 1193:              0 ->
 1194:                  if
 1195:                      false ->
 1196:                          error
 1197:                  end
 1198:          end,
 1199:      try
 1200:          ok
 1201:      catch
 1202:          error:_ ->
 1203:              error
 1204:      end}.
 1205: 
 1206: %% With the `no_copt` and `no_ssa_opt` options, an internal
 1207: %% consistency error would be reported:
 1208: %%
 1209: %% Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
 1210: %% Instruction: {test_heap,2,2}
 1211: %% Error:       {{x,0},not_live}:
 1212: grab_bag_21(A) ->
 1213:     _ = id(0),
 1214:     grab_bag_21(ok, A div 10, node(), [-1]).
 1215: 
 1216: grab_bag_21(_, D, _, _) ->
 1217:     D.
 1218: 
 1219: %% GH-7128: With optimizations disabled, the code would fail to
 1220: %% load with the following message:
 1221: %%
 1222: %%    beam/beam_load.c(367): Error loading function
 1223: %%      beam_ssa_no_opt_SUITE:grab_bag_22/0: op get_list: Sdd:
 1224: %%         bad tag 2 for destination
 1225: grab_bag_22() ->
 1226:     maybe
 1227:         [_ | _] ?= ((true xor true) andalso foo),
 1228:         bar ?= id(42)
 1229:     end.
 1230: 
 1231: redundant_br(_Config) ->
 1232:     {false,{x,y,z}} = redundant_br_1(id({x,y,z})),
 1233:     {true,[[a,b,c]]} = redundant_br_1(id([[[a,b,c]]])),
 1234:     ok.
 1235: 
 1236: redundant_br_1(Specs0) ->
 1237:     {Join,Specs} =
 1238:         if
 1239:             is_list(hd(hd(Specs0))) -> {true,hd(Specs0)};
 1240:             true -> {false,Specs0}
 1241:         end,
 1242:     id({Join,Specs}).
 1243: 
 1244: -record(coverage, {name}).
 1245: 
 1246: coverage(_Config) ->
 1247: 
 1248:     %% Cover beam_ssa_codegen:force_reg/2
 1249:     no_match = case true of
 1250:                    <<_:42>> -> true;
 1251:                    _ -> no_match
 1252:               end,
 1253: 
 1254:     no_match = case [] of
 1255:                    <<$f:1.7>> -> ok;
 1256:                    _ -> no_match
 1257:                end,
 1258:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,$T},_}} = (catch coverage_1()),
 1259: 
 1260:     error = coverage_2(),
 1261:     ok = coverage_3(),
 1262:     #coverage{name=whatever} = coverage_4(),
 1263:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,ok},_}} = catch coverage_5(),
 1264: 
 1265:     ok.
 1266: 
 1267: coverage_1() ->
 1268:     <<area/signed-bitstring>> = $T.
 1269: 
 1270: coverage_2() when << []:<<0/native>> >> -> ok;
 1271: coverage_2() -> error.
 1272: 
 1273: coverage_3() ->
 1274:     %% Cover a line in beam_ssa_pre_codegen:need_frame_1/2.
 1275:     get(),
 1276:     ok.
 1277: 
 1278: coverage_4() ->
 1279:     try
 1280:         << <<42>> || false >>,
 1281:         #coverage{}
 1282:     catch
 1283:         _:_ ->
 1284:             error
 1285:     end#coverage{name = whatever}.
 1286: 
 1287: coverage_5() ->
 1288:     try
 1289:         << <<42>> || false >>,
 1290:         ok
 1291:     catch
 1292:         _:_ ->
 1293:             error
 1294:     end#coverage{name = whatever}.
 1295: 
 1296: %% Test beam_ssa:normalize/1, especially that argument types are
 1297: %% correctly updated when arguments are swapped.
 1298: normalize(_Config) ->
 1299:     normalize_commutative({bif,'band'}),
 1300:     normalize_commutative({bif,'+'}),
 1301: 
 1302:     normalize_noncommutative({bif,'div'}),
 1303: 
 1304:     ok.
 1305: 
 1306: -record(b_var, {name}).
 1307: -record(b_literal, {val}).
 1308: 
 1309: normalize_commutative(Op) ->
 1310:     A = #b_var{name=a},
 1311:     B = #b_var{name=b},
 1312:     Lit = #b_literal{val=42},
 1313: 
 1314:     normalize_same(Op, [A,B]),
 1315:     normalize_same(Op, [A,Lit]),
 1316: 
 1317:     normalize_swapped(Op, [Lit,A]),
 1318: 
 1319:     ok.
 1320: 
 1321: normalize_noncommutative(Op) ->
 1322:     A = #b_var{name=a},
 1323:     B = #b_var{name=b},
 1324:     Lit = #b_literal{val=42},
 1325: 
 1326:     normalize_same(Op, [A,B]),
 1327:     normalize_same(Op, [A,Lit]),
 1328: 
 1329:     ArgTypes0 = [{1,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)}],
 1330:     I1 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, [Lit,A]),
 1331:     I1 = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1332: 
 1333:     ok.
 1334: 
 1335: normalize_same(Op, Args) ->
 1336:     I0 = make_bset(#{}, Op, Args),
 1337:     I0 = beam_ssa:normalize(I0),
 1338: 
 1339:     ArgTypes0 = [{0,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)}],
 1340:     I1 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, Args),
 1341:     I1 = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1342: 
 1343:     case Args of
 1344:         [#b_var{},#b_var{}] ->
 1345:             ArgTypes1 = [{0,beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023)},
 1346:                          {1,beam_types:make_integer(42)}],
 1347:             I2 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1348:             I2 = beam_ssa:normalize(I2);
 1349:         [_,_] ->
 1350:             ok
 1351:     end,
 1352: 
 1353:     ok.
 1354: 
 1355: normalize_swapped(Op, [#b_literal{}=Lit,#b_var{}=Var]=Args) ->
 1356:     EmptyAnno = #{},
 1357:     I0 = make_bset(EmptyAnno, Op, Args),
 1358:     {b_set,EmptyAnno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,[Var,Lit]} = beam_ssa:normalize(I0),
 1359: 
 1360:     EmptyTypes = #{arg_types => #{}},
 1361:     I1 = make_bset(EmptyTypes, Op, Args),
 1362:     {b_set,EmptyTypes,#b_var{name=1000},Op,[Var,Lit]} = beam_ssa:normalize(I1),
 1363: 
 1364:     IntRange = beam_types:make_integer(0, 1023),
 1365:     ArgTypes0 = [{1,IntRange}],
 1366:     I2 = make_bset(ArgTypes0, Op, Args),
 1367:     {[{0,IntRange}],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I2)),
 1368: 
 1369:     LitType = beam_types:make_type_from_value(Lit),
 1370: 
 1371:     ArgTypes1 = [{0,LitType}],
 1372:     I3 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1373:     {[],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I3)),
 1374: 
 1375:     ArgTypes2 = [{0,LitType},{1,IntRange}],
 1376:     I4 = make_bset(ArgTypes1, Op, Args),
 1377:     {[],Op,[Var,Lit]} = unpack_bset(beam_ssa:normalize(I4)),
 1378: 
 1379:     ok.
 1380: 
 1381: make_bset(ArgTypes, Op, Args) when is_list(ArgTypes) ->
 1382:     Anno = #{arg_types => maps:from_list(ArgTypes)},
 1383:     {b_set,Anno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,Args};
 1384: make_bset(Anno, Op, Args) when is_map(Anno) ->
 1385:     {b_set,Anno,#b_var{name=1000},Op,Args}.
 1386: 
 1387: unpack_bset({b_set,Anno,{b_var,1000},Op,Args}) ->
 1388:     ArgTypes = maps:get(arg_types, Anno, #{}),
 1389:     {lists:sort(maps:to_list(ArgTypes)),Op,Args}.
 1390: 
 1391: trycatch(_Config) ->
 1392:     8 = trycatch_1(),
 1393: 
 1394:     ok = trycatch_2(id(ok)),
 1395:     ok = trycatch_2(id(z)),
 1396: 
 1397:     false = trycatch_3(id(42)),
 1398: 
 1399:     ok.
 1400: 
 1401: trycatch_1() ->
 1402:     try B = (A = bit_size(iolist_to_binary("a"))) rem 1 of
 1403:         _ ->
 1404:             A;
 1405:         _ ->
 1406:             B
 1407:     after
 1408:         ok
 1409:     end.
 1410: 
 1411: trycatch_2(A) ->
 1412:     try not (B = (ok >= A)) of
 1413:         B ->
 1414:             iolist_size(maybe
 1415:                             [] ?= B,
 1416:                             <<>> ?= list_to_binary(ok)
 1417:                         end);
 1418:         _ ->
 1419:             ok
 1420:     after
 1421:         ok
 1422:     end.
 1423: 
 1424: trycatch_3(A) ->
 1425:     try erlang:bump_reductions(A) of
 1426:         B ->
 1427:             try not (C = (B andalso is_number(ok))) of
 1428:                 C ->
 1429:                     ok andalso ok;
 1430:                 _ ->
 1431:                     C
 1432:             catch
 1433:                 _ ->
 1434:                     ok
 1435:             end
 1436:     after
 1437:         ok
 1438:     end.
 1439: 
 1440: %% GH-6599. beam_validator would not realize that the code was safe.
 1441: gh_6599(_Config) ->
 1442:     ok = gh_6599_1(id(42), id(42)),
 1443:     #{ok := ok} = gh_6599_1(id(#{ok => 0}), id(#{ok => 0})),
 1444: 
 1445:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,#{ok:=ok}},_}} =
 1446:         catch gh_6599_2(id(whatever), id(#{0 => whatever})),
 1447: 
 1448:     ok = gh_6599_3(id(true), id(true)),
 1449:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch gh_6599_3(id(false), id(false)),
 1450:     0.0 = gh_6599_3(id(0.0), id(0.0)),
 1451: 
 1452:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,true},_}} = catch gh_6599_4(id(false)),
 1453: 
 1454:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,ok},_}} = catch gh_6599_5(id([a]), id(#{0 => [a]}), id([a])),
 1455: 
 1456:     #{ok := ok} = gh_6599_6(id(#{}), id(#{})),
 1457:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,a},_}} = catch gh_6599_6(id(a), id(a)),
 1458: 
 1459:     {'EXIT',{{badarg,ok},_}} = catch gh_6599_7(id([a]), id([a])),
 1460: 
 1461:     ok.
 1462: 
 1463: gh_6599_1(X, X) when is_integer(X) ->
 1464:     ok;
 1465: gh_6599_1(Y, Y = #{}) ->
 1466:     Y#{ok := ok}.
 1467: 
 1468: gh_6599_2(X, #{0 := X, 0 := Y}) ->
 1469:     try #{ok => ok} of
 1470:         Y ->
 1471:             bnot (Y = X)
 1472:     after
 1473:         ok
 1474:     end.
 1475: 
 1476: gh_6599_3(X, X) when X ->
 1477:     ok;
 1478: gh_6599_3(X, X = 0.0) ->
 1479:     X + X.
 1480: 
 1481: gh_6599_4(X) ->
 1482:     Y =
 1483:         try
 1484:             false = X
 1485:         catch
 1486:             _ ->
 1487:                 ok
 1488:         end /= ok,
 1489:     X = Y,
 1490:     false = Y,
 1491:     0 = ok.
 1492: 
 1493: %% Crashes in beam_ssa_type because a type assertion fails.
 1494: gh_6599_5(X, #{0 := X, 0 := Y}, Y=[_ | _]) ->
 1495:     try
 1496:         Y = ok
 1497:     catch
 1498:         _ ->
 1499:             [_ | []] = Y = X
 1500:     end.
 1501: 
 1502: gh_6599_6(A, B = A) ->
 1503:     A#{},
 1504:     case A of B -> B end#{ok => ok}.
 1505: 
 1506: gh_6599_7(X, Y) ->
 1507:     try Y of
 1508:         X ->
 1509:             (id(
 1510:                 try ([_ | _] = Y) of
 1511:                     X ->
 1512:                         ok
 1513:                 after
 1514:                     ok
 1515:                 end
 1516:             ) orelse X) bsl 0
 1517:     after
 1518:         ok
 1519:     end.
 1520: 
 1521: 
 1522: %% The identity function.
 1523: id(I) -> I.
